Allergic conjunctivitis is one of the most common eye diseases. Ocular symptoms are present in 80% of cases of allergic rhinitis: tearing, redness, itching, etc.

painless'' (see item 83)

Diagnosis is based on :

- clinical signs

- the presence of sensitisation (positive prick tests or detection of allergen-specific IgE antibodies)

- conjunctival provocation testing with the suspected allergen (triggering acute conjunctivitis if allergic) is reserved for research purposes.

question.question: Which of the following is the primary method used to diagnose allergic conjunctivitis?
question.option_a: Conducting a detailed medical history and physical examination
question.option_b: Performing a conjunctival provocation test with the suspected allergen
question.option_c: Measuring the level of eosinophils in the blood
question.option_d: Identifying the presence of sensitization through positive prick tests or detection of allergen-specific IgE antibodies
